citation.article-title: Vogesella lacus sp. nov., isolated from a soft-shell turtle culture pond
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Vogesella lacus sp. nov.
Vogesella lacus (la′cus. L. gen. n. lacus of a lake or pond, referring to the source of isolation of the type strain).
Cells are Gram-negative, aerobic, rod-shaped, non-spore-forming and motile by means of a single polar flagellum.
Poly-β-hydroxybutyrate granules are accumulated.
After 48 h growth on R2A agar at 25 °C, the mean cell size is about 0.8 μm in width and 1.5–2.3 μm in length.
Forms visible, round, entire, convex and colourless colonies.
The colony size is approximately 1.0–2.0 mm diameter on R2A agar after 48 h incubation at 25 °C.
Grows at 10, 15, 25, 30, 37 and 42 °C, 0–3 % (w/v) NaCl and pH 7–9.
Optimal growth occurs at 25–30 °C, 0.5 % NaCl and pH 7.
Positive for catalase, oxidase, lipase (corn oil), DNase (weak) activities.
Positive for hydrolysis of casein and Tweens 40 (weak), 60 and 80.
Negative for hydrolysis of starch and Tween 20.
The major fatty acids are summed feature 3 (C16 : 1ω7c and/or C15 : 0 iso 2-OH), C16 : 0 and C18 : 1ω7c.
Additional phenotypic properties are listed in Table 2.
In API 20NE tests, strain GR13T shows positive reactions for nitrate reduction, indole production and for the assimilation of d-glucose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, citrate and malate.

Gives a negative reaction for d-glucose acidification, activities of l-arginine dihydrolase, urease, β-glucosidase, protease, β-galactosidase and for the assimilation of l-arabinose, maltose, N-acetylglucosamine, adipate, phenylacetate, gluconate and caprate.

The following compounds are oxidized in the Biolog GN2 test system: α-d-glucose, d-fructose, d-mannose, d-psicose, d-mannitol, N-acetyl-d-glucosamine, glycogen, Tween 40, Tween 80, dl-lactic acid, γ-aminobutyric acid, citric acid, l-histidine, hydroxy-l-proline, l-alanine, l-proline, l-asparagine, l-aspartic acid, l-glutamic acid, l-ornithine, l-phenylalanine and l-alanyl glycine.

Strain GR13T is unable to oxidize maltose, cellobiose, l-arabinose, l-rhamnose, melibiose, d-galactose, raffinose, gentiobiose, α-d-lactose, trehalose, lactulose, turanose, d-sorbitol, 2,3-butanediol, i-erythritol, adonitol, xylitol, d-arabitol, myo-inositol, glycerol, N-acetyl-d-galactosamine, sucrose, α-cyclodextrin, dextrin, methyl β-d-glucoside, acetic acid, d-glucosaminic acid, p-hydroxyphenylacetic acid, bromosuccinic acid, urocanic acid, cis-aconitic acid, itaconic acid, succinamic acid, α-ketobutyric acid, glucuronamide, l-leucine, l-serine, l-threonine, d-serine, d-alanine, phenylethylamine, l-pyroglutamic acid, glycyl l-aspartic acid, glycyl l-glutamic acid, dl-carnitine, d-alaninamide, 2-aminoethanol, putrescine, uridine, thymidine, inosine, formic acid, α-ketoglutaric acid, d-galacturonic acid, d-galactonic acid lactone, α-ketovaleric acid, d-gluconic acid, malonic acid, propionic acid, d-glucuronic acid, quinic acid, α-hydroxybutyric acid, γ-hydroxybutyric acid, d-saccharic acid, dl-α-glycerol phosphate, pyruvic acid methyl ester, β-hydroxybutyric acid, sebacic acid, α-d-glucose 1-phosphate, succinic acid monomethyl ester, succinic acid and d-glucose 6-phosphate.

The type strain is sensitive to tetracycline, kanamycin, rifampicin, gentamicin, penicillin G, chloramphenicol, nalidixic acid, novobiocin, streptomycin, ampicillin and sulfamethoxazole plus trimethoprim.
The type strain, GR13T (=BCRC 17836T=LMG 24504T), was isolated from a freshwater pond used for the culture of soft-shell turtles (Trionyx sinensis), Pingtung County, Taiwan.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 63 mol%.
